sen.j: 大和路線（やまとじせん）は、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）関西本線の加茂駅 (京都府)からJR難波駅までの電化区間に付けられた愛称。
sen.e: The Yamatoji Line is a nickname for the electrified section between Kamo station (Kyoto prefecture) and JR Namba station on Kansai Main Line of West Japan Railway Company (JR West Japan).

sen.cmt: capitalized "Station" where necessary; capitalized "Prefecture"; eliminated "The" before "Yamatoji"; added "of rail" after "section";
sen.e: Yamatoji Line is the nickname for the electrified section of rail between Kamo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and JR Nanba Station that runs on the Kansai Main Line of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West Japan).

sen.j: 天王寺駅 - 今宮駅間は大阪環状線と重複する。

sen.e: The section between Tennoji Station and Imamiya Station overlaps with the Osaka Loop Line.

sen.e: The line color of Japanese railway is green (), because "green has the image of a relaxed old city and a newly developed area."

sen.j: JR発足後は大阪駅（キタ）への直通列車が毎時3本に増発された。
sen.e: After the inauguration of JR, three direct trains for Osaka station (Kita, north) have increasingly run every one hour.
After the inauguration of JR, the number of direct trains running north to Osaka Station have been increased to three every hour.

sen.j: 大阪府内の駅の利用者が多く、奈良県内では乗客が減るが、県内の学生の利用者などで少し増える。
sen.e: There are many users of stations in Osaka prefecture and the number of users decreases in Nara prefecture, but the student users in Nara prefecture increase a little bit.
The bulk of the passengers use the stations in Osaka Prefecture, and although the number of passengers decrease in Nara Prefecture, there is a slight increase in other passengers, such as students.
sen.cmt: capitalized "Prefecture" in both cases; fixed grammar to read more naturally

sen.j: 利用者が少なくはないが、関西圏では古い車両や、短い編成の電車が多い。
sen.e: The number of users is not small, but in Kansai area there are many old vehicles and short-car train sets.
In spite of the large number of passengers, many of the railroad cars are old and operated with short-car sets in the Kansai area.
sen.cmt: changed "but" to "In spite of" and used at the beginning of the sentence; changed "vehicles" to "railroad cars"; changed "short-car train sets" to "short-car sets"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: In spite of the large number of passengers, many of the railroad cars are old and operated with short-car sets in the Kansai area.

sen.j: 現在、アーバンネットワーク運行管理システムの導入工事が行われているほか、平野駅付近では上り線の一部を使用して貨物列車が運転しているおおさか東線城東貨物線との分離工事が、奈良駅では高架化と共にバリアフリー対応工事が進められている。
sen.e: At present, in addition to the construction work on introduction of management system for the Urban Network, the construction work on disconnection from the Joto Goods Line of Osaka Higashi Line which operates freight trains, using a part of up lines near Hirano station, and at Nara station the construction work on barrier free is advanced as well as the station elevated

In addition to the construction work currently taking place to introduce an Urban Network traffic control system, there is construction underway near the Hirano Station to separate the Joto Goods Line and Osaka Higashi Line operating on a section of track used by incoming freight trains; while at the Nara Station, corresponding construction is taking place to elevate the track, making it barrier free.
sen.cmt: changed "At present" to "currently" and used in the middle of the sentence; had to redo this translation since I could not understand translation 1; As I understand it, "おおさか東線城東貨物線" is referring to the "Joto Goods Line" that is a freight train and the "Osaka Higashi Line" that share a section of track used by incoming freight trains. It is not clear to me if the "separation construction" (分離工事) is to separate these two lines from each other, or to separate the two lines from the track being used by freight trains.
sen.e: In addition to the construction work currently taking place to introduce an Urban Network traffic control system, there is construction underway near the Hirano Station to separate the Joto Goods Line of Osaka Higashi Line operating on a section of track used by incoming freight trains; while at the Nara Station, corresponding construction is taking place to elevate the track as well as making it barrier free.
sen.cmt: 原文に合うように修正しました。

sen.j: 大和路線各駅では乗車カードとしてICOCAおよびこれと相互利用可能なICカード（ICOCAを参照）が、またJスルーが自動券売機で乗車券に引き換えることで利用できる。
sen.e: At each station on the Yamatoji Line, ICOCA and IC card interchangeable with ICOCA (see ICOCA) can be used and J Through card can also be used by exchanging it with a ticket at the automatic ticket machine.

At each station on the Yamatoji Line, the ICOCA card and the IC card that is interchangable with the ICOCA (see ICOCA), as well as the J Through (Jスルー) card can be used as a travel card by making an exhange at automatic ticket machines for a passenger ticket.
sen.cmt: added Japanese version in parenthesis for "J Through"; fixed grammar to read more understandably
sen.e: At each station on the Yamatoji Line, the ICOCA card and the IC card that is interchangeable with the ICOCA (see ICOCA), as well as the J Through (Jスルー) card can be used as a travel card by making an exchange at automatic ticket machines for a passenger ticket.

sen.j: 2004年の近畿交通審議会答申第8号で「輸送力の強化等によるサービス向上に資する事業」として、加茂 - 木津間の複線化が盛り込まれているが、複線化の動きはない。
sen.e: In the eighth report of the Council for Kinki Regional Transport of 2004, making the line between Kamo and Kizu double track was included as "the project for improving services by strengthening the power of transport and so on," but the action for the double track has not been seen.

In the eighth report of the Council for Kinki Regional Transport of 2004, plans were created to make the section between Kamo and Kizu a double track as part of the "project for improving services by strengthening the power of transport and so on," but there have been no developments toward this plan.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: In the eighth report of the Council for Kinki Regional Transport of 2004, plans were created to make the section between Kamo and Kizu a double track as part of the 'project for improving services by strengthening the power of transport and so on,' but there have been no developments toward this plan.

sen.j: 大和路線ではホームライナーである「やまとじライナー」と、大和路快速・快速列車・列車種別区間種別・おおさか東線運行形態・普通列車（各駅停車）が運転されている。
sen.e: In the Yamatoji Line, the home liner "Yamatoji Liner," Yamatoji Rapid Services, rapid trains, the trains running according to the types of train or the types of section, the form of operation of Osaka Higashi Line and local trains (the trains which stops at every station) are running.
sen.cmt: 「運転されている」という述語に対して、「列車種別区間種別・おおさか東線運行形態」だけ不自然な感じがありますが、原文どおり訳しました。
sen.e: On the Yamatoji Line, operations include running the home liner called "Yamatoji Liner," running Yamatoji Rapid Services and rapid trains, running trains according to train type and train section, conforming to operations on the Osaka Higashi Line and local trains (trains that stop at every station).
sen.cmt: changed "In" to "On"; added "operations" near the beginning of the sentence to replace "are running" coming at the end; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: On the Yamatoji Line, operations include running the home liner called 'Yamatoji Liner,' running Yamatoji Rapid Services and rapid trains, running trains according to train type and train section, conforming to operations on the Osaka Higashi Line and local trains (trains that stop at every station).

sen.j: 基本的に日中の大阪方面からは、普通が柏原駅 (大阪府)と奈良駅まで、快速が和歌山線直通、大和路快速が奈良方面への運転となっている。
sen.e: Basically in the daytime, from Osaka quarter, local trains run until Kashiwara station (Osaka prefecture) and Nara station, rapid trains run through Wakayama Line, Yamatoji Rapid Services run for Nara quarter.

In standard daytime operations starting from the Osaka area, local trains run to Kashiwara Station (Osaka Prefecture) and Nara Station, rapid trains run through the Wakayama Line, and Yamatoji Rapid Service trains run to the Nara area.
sen.cmt: changed "Basically" to "standard"; added "operations"; capitalized "Station"; capitalized "Prefecture"; fixed grammar to read more understandably
sen.e: In standard daytime operations starting from the Osaka area, local trains run to Kashiwara Station (Osaka Prefecture) and Nara Station, rapid trains run through the Wakayama Line, and Yamatoji Rapid Service trains run to the Nara area.

sen.j: 以下に種別毎の概要を示す。
sen.e: The following is the summary of each type of train.
The following is a summary of each type of train.
The following is a summary of each type of train.

sen.j: やまとじライナー（英字表記 Yamatoji Liner）は、木津発JR難波駅行1本（平日の朝ラッシュ時）と大阪発加茂行2本（平日の夕ラッシュ時）に運転されている。
sen.e: Yamatoji Liner runs from Kizu station to JR Namba station one time (in the morning rush hour on weekdays) and from Osaka to Kamo two times (during rush hour on weekdays).
The Yamatoji Liner runs once a day (during morning rush hour on weekdays) from Kizu Station to JR Namba Station, and twice a day (during rush hour on weekdays) from Osaka to Kamo.
sen.cmt: capitalized "Station" in both cases; rearranged sentence and fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: The Yamatoji Liner runs once a day (during morning rush hour on weekdays) from Kizu Station to JR Nanba Station, and twice a day (during evening rush hour on weekdays) from Osaka to Kamo.

sen.j: 乗車券のほかに乗車整理券が必要。
sen.e: In addition to a ticket, a numbered ticket for boarding is necessary.
Numbered tickets (determining order of service) are needed in addition to passenger tickets for boarding.
sen.cmt: A "numbered ticket" may have a clear meaning to some people, but the meaning is possibly vague, so I added a description;
sen.e: Numbered tickets (determining order of service) are needed in addition to passenger tickets for boarding.

sen.j: 車両は特急形車両の国鉄381系電車（日根野電車区所属の旧国鉄色編成）が使用されるが、「やまとじライナー」の種別は特急ではなく快速であるため、乗車整理券を購入さえすれば青春18きっぷでも利用できる。
sen.e: As the vehicle, Japan National Railways (JNR) 381 series of limited express car (old JNR car-train set belonging to Hineno Train Depot) are used, but the type of train of "Yamatoji Liner" is not a limited express but a rapid train and thus, if purchasing a numbered ticket for boarding, we can use it with Seishun 18 (Seishun ju-hachi kippu).

Even though the railroad cars being used are Japan National Railways' (JNR) 381 series limited express cars (old JNR cars that belong to Hineno Train Depot), the "Yamatoji Liner" is a rapid train rather than a limited express, meaning that a purchased numbered ticket can also be used as a Seishun 18 ticket.
sen.cmt: changed "vehicle" to "railroad car" for "車両"; eliminated description for "Seishun 18" since there is a wiki article in English about it; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Even though the railroad cars being used are Japan National Railways' (JNR) 381 series limited express cars (old JNR cars that belong to the Hineno Train Depot), the "Yamatoji Liner" is a rapid train rather than a limited express, meaning that you can use a Seishun 18 ticket (a discount rail ticket) provided you have purchased a numbered boarding ticket.

sen.j: 停車駅は、木津・平城山・奈良・法隆寺・王寺駅・天王寺駅・新今宮駅である。
sen.e: The stops are Kizu, Narayama, Nara, Horyuji, Oji station, Tennoji station and Shin-Imamiya station.
The Yamatoji Liner stops at Kizu, Narayama, Nara, Horyuji, Oji Station, Tennoji Station and Shin-Imamiya Station.
sen.cmt: changed "The stops are" to "The Yamatoji Liner stops at"; capitalized "Station" in all cases
sen.e: The Yamatoji Liner stops at Kizu, Narayama, Nara, Horyuji, Oji Station, Tennoji Station and Shin-Imamiya Station.

sen.j: すべての快速が久宝寺に停車するようになってからは唯一の天王寺 - 王寺間ノンストップの列車である。
sen.e: Since all the rapid trains stopped at Kyuhoji, it has been only one train which does not stop between Tennoji and Oji.
Ever since every rapid train started to make stops at Kyuhoji, the Yamatoji Liner became the only train to run nonstop between Tennoji and Oji.
sen.cmt: changed "Since" to "Ever since"; fixed grammar to read more understandably
sen.e: Ever since every rapid train started to make stops at Kyuhoji, the Yamatoji Liner became the only train to run nonstop between Tennoji and Oji.

sen.j: なお、大阪のポケット時刻表には、新今宮・天王寺に停車する案内はされていない。
sen.e: And in the pocket edition time table in Osaka, there is no information on the stop at Shin-Imamiya and Tennoji.
Furthermore, in the Osaka pocket edition timetable, no information is given about the stops in Shin-Imamiya and Tennoji.
sen.cmt: chnaged "And" to "Furthermore" for "なお"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Furthermore, in the Osaka pocket edition timetable, no information is given about the stops in Shin-Imamiya and Tennoji.

sen.j: 2009年3月のダイヤ改正で土曜日は運転取りやめとなり、平日のみの運転となった。
sen.e: By the timetable revision of March, 2009, it was halted to run on Saturdays and has run only on weekdays.
Due to a revision of the timetable made in March of 2009, Saturday operations were cancelled and the Yamatoji Liner started to run only on the weekdays.
sen.cmt: changed "it" to "the Yamatoji Liner"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Due to a revision of the timetable made in March of 2009, Saturday operations were cancelled and the Yamatoji Liner started to run only on the weekdays.

sen.j: 大和路快速（英字表記 Yamatoji Rapid Service）は大和路線の代表的な列車で、大阪駅 - 加茂駅 (京都府)間で昼間を中心に約20分間隔で運転されている（土曜・休日には朝や夕方にも運転）。
sen.e: Yamatoji Rapid Service is a typical train on the Yamatoji Line and runs between Osaka station and Kamo station (Kyoto prefecture) mainly in the daytime every twenty minutes (on Saturdays and holidays it runs also in the morning and evening).

Yamatoji Rapid Service is a typical train on the Yamatoji Line, running mainly during the daytime every twenty minutes between Osaka Station and Kamo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) (on Saturdays and holidays it also runs during the morning and evening).
sen.cmt: rearranged sentence to read more naturally; capitalized "Station" and "Prefecture";
sen.e: Yamatoji Rapid Service is a typical train on the Yamatoji Line, running mainly during the daytime every twenty minutes between Osaka Station and Kamo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) (on Saturdays and holidays it also runs during the morning and evening).

sen.j: 関西本線と大阪環状線を直通する快速列車は1973年の関西本線電化以来、国鉄時代から運転されていたが、「大和路快速」の名が付いたのは1989年3月からである。
sen.e: The rapid trains directly running through Kansai Main Line and Osaka Loop Line have been operated since the electrification of Kansai Main Line of 1973 or since the JNR period, but it was not until March 1989 that the name "Yamatoji Rapid Service" was given to them.

Rapid trains that run directly through the Kansai Main Line and the Osaka Loop Line have operated since the Kansai Main Line was electrified in 1973 during the JNR period, but it was not until March of 1989 that these trains came to be called "Yamatoji Rapid Service."
sen.cmt: changed "or since the JNR period" to "during the JNR period"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Rapid trains that run directly through the Kansai Main Line and the Osaka Loop Line have operated since the Kansai Main Line was electrified in 1973 during the JNR period, but it was not until March of 1989 that these trains came to be called 'Yamatoji Rapid Service.'

sen.j: この愛称は公募で付けられた。
sen.e: The nickname was given through open recruitment.
The nickname was chosen by the public.
The nickname was chosen by the public.

sen.j: 始発・終着駅は天王寺で、天王寺（環状線ホーム）から京橋駅 (大阪府)・大阪・弁天町駅を経由して天王寺（大和路線ホーム） - 奈良 - 加茂と、大阪環状線を一周し、大和路線へ入る運転系統となっている。
sen.e: The departure and arrival station is Tennoji and as the operation system, it runs from Tennoji (platform of Osaka Loop Line) through Kyobashi station (Osaka prefecture), Osaka, Bentencho station, Tennoji (platform of Yamatoji Line), Nara, Kamo and runs around Osaka Loop Line and runs into Yamatoji Line.

The Yamatoji Rapid Service starting and terminal station is Tennoji, with an operational system set to depart from Tennoji (Osaka Loop Line Platform) and run through Kyobashi Station (Osaka Prefecture), Osaka and Bentocho Station, then from Tennoji (Yamatoji Line Platform), it runs to Nara and Kamo, makes a lap around the Osaka Loop Line and then enters the Yamatoji Line.
sen.cmt: added "Yamatoji Rapid Service" for a clearer subject; capitalized "Station" when used after a station name; fixed to read more understandably
sen.e: The Yamatoji Rapid Service starting and terminal station is Tennoji, with an operational system set to depart from Tennoji (Osaka Loop Line Platform) and run through Kyobashi Station (Osaka Prefecture), Osaka and Bentencho Station, then from Tennoji (Yamatoji Line Platform), it runs to Nara and Kamo, makes a lap around the Osaka Loop Line and then enters the Yamatoji Line.

sen.j: そのため、加茂・奈良方面から大阪方面行の行先案内表示は「大和路快速 大阪環状線」と表示される。
sen.e: For this reason, on the destination information board for Osaka quarter from Kamo and Nara quarter indicates "Yamatoji Rapid Service, Osaka Loop Line."
This is why the destination board indicates "Yamatoji Rapid Service, Osaka Loop Line" for travelling from the Kamo and Nara areas to the Osaka area.
sen.cmt: rearranged sentence and fixed grammar to read more understandably; changed "quarter" to "area"
sen.e: This is why the destination board indicates 'Yamatoji Rapid Service, Osaka Loop Line' for travelling from the Kamo and Nara areas to the Osaka area.

sen.j: 全列車JR西日本221系電車での運転で6両編成が基本となっているが、ラッシュ時の前後には8両編成で運転される列車も存在する。
sen.e: All the trains are JR West Japan 221 series and basically run in 6-car train set, but around rush hour some run in 8-car train set.
Although all of the JR West Japan 221 series run with a standard six-car set, some run with an eight-car set around rush hour.
sen.cmt: changed "6-car" to "six-car" and "8-car" to "eight-car"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Although all of the JR West Japan 221 series run with a standard six-car set, some run with an eight-car set around rush hour.

sen.j: また土曜・休日の一部の大和路快速は、王寺で後部の4両または2両を分割し、和歌山線高田駅 (奈良県)・五条駅 (奈良県)方面へ直通運転をしている。
sen.e: And some of Yamatoji Rapid Services on Saturdays and holidays detach the back 4 or 2 vehicles at Oji and run through Takada station on Wakayama Line (Nara prefecture) and Gojo station (Nara prefecture) quarter.

A number of Yamatoji Rapid Service trains running on Saturdays and holidays have their back two or four cars detached at Oji and run through Takada Station on the Wakayama Line (Nara Prefecture) and Gojo Station (Nara Prefecture).
sen.cmt: changed "And some of" to "A number of"; changed "Yamatoji Rapid Services" to "Yamatoji Rapid Service trains"; changed "the back 4 or 2 vehicles" to "their back two or four cars"; eliminated "quarter" after (Nara Prefecture); capitalized "Station" and "Prefecture"; fixed grammar to read more understandably
sen.e: A number of Yamatoji Rapid Service trains running on Saturdays and holidays have their back two or four cars detached at Oji and run through Takada Station on the Wakayama Line (Nara Prefecture) and Gojo Station (Nara Prefecture).

sen.j: 加茂発着の列車の一部は加茂駅で関西本線伊賀上野駅、亀山駅 (三重県)方面の列車と相互接続を行う。
sen.e: Some trains running to and from Kamo are connected with the trains for Iga-Ueno station on Kansai Main Line and the ones for Kameyama station (Mie prefecture) quarter.
A few trains arriving and departing from Kamo are connected with trains heading towards Iga-Ueno Station on the Kansai Main Line as well as trains heading for Kameyama Station (Mie Prefecture).
sen.cmt: changed "Some" to "A few"; chnaged "running to and from" to "arriving and departing"; changed "trains for Iga-Ueno" to "trains heading towards"; capitalized "Station" and "Prefecture";
sen.e: A few trains arriving and departing from Kamo are connected with trains heading towards Iga-Ueno Station on the Kansai Main Line as well as trains heading for Kameyama Station (Mie Prefecture).

sen.j: 120km/h運転に伴い、以前は大阪 - 奈良間は最速で41分、天王寺 - 奈良間は29分であった。
sen.e: With the speed of 120 km/h, it formerly ran between Osaka and Nara in 41 minutes and between Tennoji and Nara in 29 minutes at the fastest, but, as the running performance of 221 series was extremely utilized and a majority of passengers got on and off at Tennoji and Oji but the stoppage time was not long enough, a few minutes chronic delay happened every day.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: With speeds of up to 120 km/h, Yamatoji Rapid Service trains used to run between Osaka and Nara in forty-one minutes and between Tennoji and Nara in twenty-nine minutes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処; changed "it" to "Yamatoji Rapid Service"; 41→forty-one; 29→twenty-nine; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: With speeds of up to 120 km/h, Yamatoji Rapid Service trains used to run between Osaka and Nara in forty-one minutes and between Tennoji and Nara in twenty-nine minutes.

sen.j: これは、運転曲線を221系の性能を極度に使ったものである上、過半数の乗客が乗降する天王寺や王寺での停車時間が十分に確保されていなかったため、数分程度の慢性的な遅延が毎日のように発生していた。
sen.cmt: 「運転曲線」が不明で、また「運転曲線を221系の性能を」と「を」が連続し、構文上の困難が発生しております。一原文一訳文例外対処 － であるのに加え、→それに加え、
sen.e: However, as the efficiency of the 221 Series became utilized to its full extent, with the majority of passengers getting on and off at Tennoji and Oji with insufficient stop times, persistent delays of a few minutes became a daily occurence.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処; changed "chronic delay" to "persistent delays"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: However, as the efficiency of the 221 Series became utilized to its full extent, with the majority of passengers getting on and off at Tennoji and Oji with insufficient stop times, persistent delays of a few minutes became a daily occurrence.

sen.j: このため、2001年3月のダイヤ改正時の久宝寺駅停車を機に、大阪 - 奈良間の所要時間が最速44分に延長された。
sen.e: For this reason, when it stopped at Kyuhoji station at the timetable revision of March, 2001, the required time between Osaka and Nara was extended to 44 minutes at the fastest.
Taking advantage of the timetable revision made in March of 2001 to have the train stop at Kyuhoji Station, the required time between Osaka and Nara was extended to forty-four minutes at the fastest.
sen.cmt: eliminated "For this reason"; added "Taking advantage of" for "機に"; 44→forty-four; capitalized Station; fixed grammar
sen.e: Taking advantage of the timetable revision made in March of 2001 to have the train stop at Kyuhoji Station, the required time between Osaka and Nara was extended to forty-four minutes at the fastest.

sen.j: さらに、JR福知山線脱線事故の影響でさらに余裕時分を足したこともあり、2006年3月18日ダイヤ改正では大阪駅 - 奈良駅間は最速46分、天王寺 - 奈良間は同33分と延びている。
sen.e: Furthermore, by the influence of the derailment accident on the JR Fukuchiyama Line, good time was added and at the timetable revision of March 18, 2006 the required time was extended to 46 minutes between Osaka station and Nara station and to 33 minutes between Tennoji and Nara at the fastest.

Furthermore, in the aftermath of the derailment accident on the JR Fukuchiyama Line, more time was added in the timetable revision made on March 18, 2006 where the fastest time between Osaka Station and Nara Station was extended to forty-six minutes and to thirty-three minutes between Tennoji and Nara.
sen.cmt: changed "influence" to "aftermath" for "影響"; 46→forty-six; 33→thirty-three; changed "required time" to "fastest time" and eliminated "at the fastest" at the end of the sentence; fixed grammar to read more smoothly
sen.e: Furthermore, in the aftermath of the derailment accident on the JR Fukuchiyama Line, more time was added in the timetable revision made on March 18, 2006 where the fastest time between Osaka Station and Nara Station was extended to forty-six minutes and to thirty-three minutes between Tennoji and Nara.

sen.j: また、このダイヤ改正で大阪方面行の列車は、木津または奈良で長時間停車するようになった。
sen.e: And by this timetable revision the trains for Osaka quarter came to stop at Kizu or Nara for a long time.
By this timetable revision, trains headed for the Osaka area came to have long stops in Kizu and Nara.
sen.cmt: eliminated "And"; added comma after "revision"; changed "trains for Osaka quarter" to "trains headed for the Osaka area" for "大阪方面行"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: By this timetable revision, trains headed for the Osaka area came to have long stops in Kizu and Nara.

sen.j: これは列車の遅れを解消させる思惑があるといえるが、加茂駅からの所要時間は大幅に伸びている。
sen.e: This is said to be because of prevention of delays, but the required time from Kamo station increased largely.
Although this change was allegedly made to resolve train delays, the required time to ride from Kamo Station has increased drastically.
sen.cmt: changed "but" to "Although" and used at the beginning of the sentence; changed "prevention of delays" to "resolve train delays" for "列車の遅れを解消させる"; changed "largely" to "drastically" for "大幅"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Although this change was allegedly made to resolve train delays, the required time to ride from Kamo Station has increased drastically.

sen.j: なお、天理教の例会があるときは桜井線の天理まで臨時運転されるときがある。
sen.e: And when there is a regular meeting of Tenrikyo sect, sometimes it temporarily runs to Tenri on Sakurai Line.
Yamatoji Rapid Service trains are sometimes run temporarily to Tenri on the Sakurai Line when the Tenrikyo Sect holds their regular meetings,
sen.cmt: eliminated "And"; capitalized "Sect"; changed "it" to "Yamatoji Rapid Service trains"; rearranged sentence to read more naturally
sen.e: Yamatoji Rapid Service trains are sometimes run temporarily to Tenri on the Sakurai Line when the Tenrikyo Sect holds their regular meetings,

sen.j: おおさか東線直通快速（英字表記 Direct Rapid Service）は、2008年3月15日のおおさか東線部分開業により設定された列車で、おおさか東線・片町線・JR東西線経由で奈良 - 尼崎間で運転されている。
sen.e: Direct Rapid Service on Osaka Higashi Line is the train set up at the partly opening of Osaka Higashi Line of March 15, 2008 and runs between Nara and Amagasaki through Osaka Higashi Line, Katamachi Line and JR Tozai Line.

Direct Rapid Service on the Osaka Higashi Line is a train that was established as part of the inauguration of the Osaka Higashi Line on March 15, 2008; it runs via the Osaka Higashi Line, Katamachi Line and JR Tozai Line between Nara and Amagasaki.
sen.cmt: changed "and" to a semi-colon; changed "set up" to "established" for "設定された"; changed "partly opening" to "part of the inauguration" for "部分開業"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Direct Rapid Service on the Osaka Higashi Line is a train that was established as part of the inauguration of the Osaka Higashi Line on March 15, 2008; it runs via the Osaka Higashi Line, Katamachi Line and JR Tozai Line between Nara and Amagasaki.

sen.j: 運転本数は1日上下8本で、朝に奈良発4本、夕方に尼崎発4本が運転される。
sen.e: The number of operations of up line and down line is 8 per one day and it starts from Nara four times in the morning and from Amagasaki four times in the evening.
Direct Rapid Service trains run eight times a day, with four runs in the morning starting from Nara and four runs in the evening starting from Amagasaki.
Direct Rapid Service trains run eight times a day, with four runs in the morning starting from Nara and four runs in the evening starting from Amagasaki.

sen.j: 車両は剛体架線であるJR東西線を経由するため2集電装置パンタグラフのJR西日本223系電車6000番台 （宮原車）の宮原総合運転所所属車が使用されている。
sen.e: As the vehicle, JR West Japan 223 series 6000s number of two power collectors pantograph (Miyahara car) belonging to Miyahara Integrated Operation Canters are used in order to run by way of JR Tozai Line which is a rigid conductor line.

Railroad cars used on these trains are Miyahara Integrated Operation Center's JR West Japan 223-6000 series (Miyahara car) that utilize double-arm pantographs in order to run on the JR Tozai Line with rigid body overhead lines.
sen.cmt: changed "two power collectors pantograph" to "double-arm pantographs" for "2集電装置パンタグラフ" (found this information from the wikipedia article <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pantograph_%28rail%29#Single-_and_double-arm_pantographs>); changed "rigid conductor line" to "rigid body overhead lines" for "剛体架線"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Railroad cars used on these trains are Miyahara Integrated Operation Center's JR West Japan 223-6000 series (Miyahara car) that utilize double-arm pantographs in order to run on the JR Tozai Line with rigid body overhead lines.

sen.j: 平日ダイヤにおいて、奈良発尼崎行は、4本中3本が久宝寺で快速JR難波行（後述の柏原始発列車）と同一ホームで互いに乗り換えができるようにダイヤが組まれている。
sen.e: In the timetable on weekdays, as for the trains from Nara to Amagasaki, the three of the four are arranged to be connected with rapid trains for JR Namba (the first train from Kashiwara, as mentioned below) on the same platform at Kyuhoji.

During weekdays, three out of four Direct Rapid Service trains running from Nara to Amagasaki use the same platform at Kyuhoji as rapid trains running to JR Namba (the first train from Kashiwara, mentioned below), so a timetable has been produced to make it possible to transfer between both trains.
sen.cmt: changed "the trains" to "Direct Rapid Service trains"; fixed grammar to read more understandably;
sen.e: During weekdays, three out of four Direct Rapid Service trains running from Nara to Amagasaki use the same platform at Kyuhoji as rapid trains running to JR Nanba (the first train from Kashiwara, mentioned below), so a timetable has been produced to make it possible to transfer between both trains.

sen.j: なお、JR東西線の各駅と奈良の間には、直通快速以外にも木津経由の快速奈良行が2本、奈良発の快速と区間快速が各1本運転されている。
sen.e: And between each station on JR Tozai Line and Nara, two rapid trains through Kizu for Nara and one rapid train from Nara and one regional rapid train from Nara are running.

In addition to the Direct Rapid Service trains that run between each station on the JR Tozai Line and Nara, two rapid trains run to Nara through Kizu, and one rapid train and one regional rapid train run from Nara.
sen.cmt: added "In addition to the Direct Rapid Service trains" for "直通快速以外にも"; fixed grammar to read more understandably
sen.e: In addition to the Direct Rapid Service trains that run between each station on the JR Tozai Line and Nara, two rapid trains run to Nara through Kizu, and one rapid train and one regional rapid train run from Nara.

tit.cmt: eliminated "Rapid train" and took "Rapid Service" out of parenthesis

sen.j: 快速（英字表記 Rapid Service）は、大和路快速に並ぶ代表的な列車種別で、ほぼ終日運転されている。
sen.e: Rapid Service is a representative type of train as well as Yamatoji Rapid Service and runs almost all day.
Rapid Service is classified as a typical train comparable to Yamatoji Rapid Service that runs almost all day.
sen.cmt: changed "representative" to "typical" for "表的な"; changed "type" to "classified" for "種別"; changed "as well as" to "comparable" for "並ぶ"; fixed grammar
sen.e: Rapid Service is classified as a typical train comparable to Yamatoji Rapid Service that runs almost all day.

sen.j: 停車駅は、JR難波・新今宮・天王寺・久宝寺・王寺からの各駅である。
sen.e: The stops are JR Namba, Shin-Imamiya, Tennoji, Kyuhoji and every station from Oji.
Stations it stops at are JR Namba, Shin-Imamiya, Tennoji, Kyuhoji and every station after Oji.
sen.cmt: changed "The stops are" to "Stations it stops at are"; changed "from Oji" to "after Oji" for "王寺からの"
sen.e: Stations it stops at are JR Nanba, Shin-Imamiya, Tennoji, Kyuhoji and every station after Oji.

sen.j: 1997年3月のダイヤ改正（後述）で一旦は区間快速に統合されていたが、今宮に停車する大阪環状線直通の区間快速への誤乗等が相次いだことや今宮を通過するJR難波発着の区間快速との区別を図る目的で、2008年3月15日のダイヤ改正でJR難波発着の区間快速を再び快速とした。
sen.e: By the timetable revision of March, 1997 (as mentioned below) it was once integrated into a regional rapid, but at the timetable revision of March 15, 2008, the regional rapid to and from JR Namba was treated again as a rapid train because many passengers mistakenly got on the regional rapid stopping at Imamiya and running through Osaka Loop Line and for the purpose of distinction from a regional rapid to and from JR Namba running through Imamiya.

In a timetable revision made in March of 1997 (mentioned below), Rapid Service was temporarily integrated as a regional rapid train, but in a revision made on March 15, 2008, the regional rapid running to and from JR Namba once again became a rapid train due to many passengers mistakenly getting on the regional rapid train stopping at Imamiya that runs through the Osaka Loop Line, as well as to make a distinction between regional rapid trains running to and from JR Namba through Imamiya.
sen.cmt: changed "By the" to "In a"; chnaged "it" to "Rapid Service"; "changed "once" to "temporarily" for "一旦"; added "running" before "to and from JR Namba"; fixed to read more understandably
sen.e: In a timetable revision made in March of 1997 (mentioned below), Rapid Service was temporarily integrated as a regional rapid train, but in a revision made on March 15, 2008, the regional rapid running to and from JR Nanba once again became a rapid train due to many passengers mistakenly getting on the regional rapid train stopping at Imamiya that runs through the Osaka Loop Line, as well as to make a distinction between regional rapid trains running to and from JR Nanba through Imamiya.

sen.j: 昼間時はJR難波 - 和歌山線高田間を20分間隔で221系の4両編成で運転している。
sen.e: During the daytime it runs between JR Namba and Takada on Wakayama Line in a 4-car train set of 221 series at ten-minute intervals.
Rapid Service trains run during the daytime between JR Namba and Takada on the Wakayama Line at ten-minute intervals in four-car sets of the 221 series.
sen.cmt: changed "it" to "Rapid Service trains"; changed "4-car" to "four-car"; eliminated "set"; rearranged sentence and fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Rapid Service trains run during the daytime between JR Nanba and Takada on the Wakayama Line at ten-minute intervals in four-car sets of the 221 series.

sen.j: 高田行は王寺で奈良行に接続する。
sen.e: The one for Takada is connected with the one for Nara at Oji.
At Oji, the train running to Takada is connected to the train running to Nara.
sen.cmt: changed "the one" to "the train"; moved "At Oji" to the beginning of the sentence; fixed grammar
sen.e: At Oji, the train running to Takada is connected to the train running to Nara.

sen.j: （王寺の配線上、同一ホームでの接続は不可能なので、柏原で追い越した普通を待つ形になる）。
sen.e: (Because of the line arrangement at Oji, the connection at the same platform is not possible and thus it has to wait the local train which it passed at Kashiwara).
(Due to the line arrangement at Oji, making a connection at the same platform is not possible, so the train has to wait for the local train it passed at Kashiwara).
sen.cmt: changed "Because of" to "Due to"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: (Due to the line arrangement at Oji, making a connection at the same platform is not possible, so the train has to wait for the local train it passed at Kashiwara).

sen.j: また1997年までの名残から高田で和歌山線（五条・橋本・和歌山方面行き）や桜井線との接続が考慮されている。
sen.e: Because of the legacy until 1997, the connection with Wakayama Line at Takada (the one for Gojo, Hashimoto and Wakayama quarter) and with Sakurai Line are considered.

Because people were accustomed to the old line connections, which had been in use until 1997, consideration was given to connecting the line to the Wakayama Line (running to Gojo, Hashimoto, Wakayama) and/or the Sakurai Line at Takada.
sen.cmt: 全体を書き直しました。
sen.e: Because people were accustomed to the old line connections, which had been in use until 1997, consideration was given to connecting the line to the Wakayama Line (running to Gojo, Hashimoto, Wakayama) and/or the Sakurai Line at Takada.

sen.j: 昼間時以外はJR難波 - 奈良・加茂間の運転が基本になるが、和歌山線へ直通運転する列車も設定されている。
sen.e: Except during the daytime, it basically runs between JR Namba and Nara, Kamo, but some run through Wakayama Line.
Except during the daytime, Rapid Service trains basically run between JR Namba, Nara and Kamo, but there are some trains set up to run through the Wakayama Line.
sen.cmt: changed "it" to "Rapid Service trains"; changed "JR Namba and Nara, Kamo," to "JR Namba, Nara and Kamo"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Except during the daytime, Rapid Service trains basically run between JR Nanba, Nara and Kamo, but there are some trains set up to run through the Wakayama Line.

sen.j: そのうちの一部の列車は、奈良行または加茂行と併結（いわゆる多層建て列車）し、王寺で切り離しを行っている。
sen.e: Some of the trains are parallelly connected with the ones for Nara and the ones for Kamo (so-called multi-layered train) and disconnected at Oji.
sen.cmt: 「併結」を、paralleｌly connectedとし、「多層建て列車」をmulti-layered trainました。
sen.e: A few of these trains are connected to trains running to Nara and Kamo (also known as a "multilayer" train) and then disconnected at Oji.
A few of these trains are connected to trains running to Nara and Kamo (also known as a "multilayer" train) and then disconnected at Oji.

sen.j: この場合に限り221系が限定運用される。
sen.e: Only in this case, 221 series are limitedly operated.
This is the only case where the 221 series is limitedly operated.
This is the only case where the 221 series is limitedly operated.

sen.j: しかし、逆の運用は、王寺に誘導信号機がないため存在しない。
sen.e: However, the reverse operation does not exist because there is no call-on signal at Oji.
However, they are not used in the opposite direction since there is no railway signal at Oji.
sen.cmt: changed "call-on signal" to "railway signal" for "誘導信号機"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: However, they are not used in the opposite direction since there is no railway signal at Oji.

sen.j: なお、朝ラッシュ時には桜井線から直通列車が運転されており、過去には夕方の桜井線直通列車や列車番号を変えて和歌山線五条駅以遠にも直通する列車も存在していた。
sen.e: And during rush hour in the morning direct trains from Sakurai Line are operated and in the past the train which ran through Gojo station eastwards on Wakayama Line existed by changing the train number of direct trains on Sakurai Line in the evening.
sen.cmt: 「桜井線直通列車や列車番号を変えて」を、「桜井線直通列車の列車番号を変えて」としました。
sen.e: Direct trains are run from the Sakurai Line during morning rush hour, while in the past, there was also a direct train run in the evening that changed numbers and ran beyond Gojo Station on the Wakayama Line.
sen.cmt: eliminated "And"; eliminated "eastwards" as I do not see anything in the Japanese to correspond to it; capitalized "Gojo Station"; rearranged sentence and fixed grammar to read more understandably
sen.e: Direct trains are run from the Sakurai Line during morning rush hour, while in the past, there was also a direct train run in the evening that changed numbers and ran beyond Gojo Station on the Wakayama Line.

sen.j: 車両は221系4両編成の運転が中心（大和路快速は上記のとおり6両）である。
sen.e: The vehicles are mainly 221 series of 4-car train sets (Yamatoji Rapid Services are 6-car train sets, as mentioned before), but during rush hours JNR 103 series of 6- or 8-car train sets belonging to Nara Train Depot, JNR 201 series of 6-car train sets (brownish green color), 103 or 201 series of 8-car train sets belonging to Morinomiya Train Depot are also operated and the variations of vehicles are wider than those of regional rapids of Osaka Loop Line.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 「だが、」→「である。」
sen.e: The main cars in operation are the 221 series with four-car sets (Yamatoji Rapid Services have six-car sets, as mentioned above).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処; changed "vehicles" to "cars"; added "in operation"; changed "mainly" to "main cars"; changed all cases of "#-car train sets" to "number-car sets"; fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: The main cars in operation are the 221 series with four-car sets (Yamatoji Rapid Services have six-car sets, as mentioned above).

sen.j: しかし、ラッシュ時には奈良電車区所属の国鉄103系電車系6・8両編成、国鉄201系電車6両編成（ウグイス色）や森ノ宮電車区所属の103系・201系8両編成も運用に入り、大阪環状線直通の区間快速と比べると車両のバリエーションが多彩である。
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 「しかし、」
sen.e: However, also put into operation during rush hour are Nara Train Depot's JNR 103 series with six or eight-car sets, JNR 201 series with six-car sets (greenish brown color) and Morinomiya Train Depot's 103 and 201 series with eight-car sets, giving a wider variation of cars than the regional rapid trains running on the Osaka Loop Line.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処; changed "rush hours" to "rush hour"; changed all cases of "#-car train sets" to "number-car sets"; chnaged "brownish green" to "greenish brown" for "ウグイス色"; fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: However, also put into operation during rush hour are Nara Train Depot's JNR 103 series with six or eight-car sets, JNR 201 series with six-car sets (greenish brown color) and Morinomiya Train Depot's 103 and 201 series with eight-car sets, giving a wider variation of cars than the regional rapid trains running on the Osaka Loop Line.

sen.j: また、2008年3月15日のダイヤ改正により種別幕が交換されたため、「快速」の文字色が橙色から緑色に変更され、さらに幕の下部に大和路線のラインカラーである緑色のラインが追加されている。
sen.e: And by the timetable revision of March 15, 2008, the category curtain was changed and thus the color of letter "rapid train" was changed from orange to green and green line, which is the line color of the Yamatoji Line, was added to the under part of the category curtain.

Due to the rollsign being changed by a schedule revision made on March 15, 2008, the color of the characters for "Rapid Service" was changed from orange to green, while a green line was added to the lower part of the rollsign for the green-colored Yamatoji Line.

This was because the sign used by one of the 103 or 201 series of JR Namba regional rapid trains traveling to Nara via Sakurai and Takada during the morning rush hour did not carry the description "Regional Rapid Service JR Namba via Sakurai and Takada."

The section of rail where they are operated is between Nara and Kamo on the Osaka Loop Line.

sen.j: 環状線内では各駅に停車する関係で、大阪 - 京橋 - 天王寺間の混雑が激しい。
sen.e: As in Osaka Loop Line it stops at each station and the section between Osaka, Kyobashi and Tennoji is heavily congested, all the trains are 221 series of 8-car train sets, but JNR 103 series (brownish green, two 4-car train sets are connected) belonging to Nara Train Depot or 103 series (orange) and 201 series belonging to Morinomiya Train Depot are also operated.

sen.e: These trains stop at every station on the loop line because the sections between Osaka, Kyobashi and Tennoji are heavily congested.

sen.j: そのため、全列車8両編成の運転で221系も使われるが、奈良電車区所属の国鉄103系電車（ウグイス色。4両編成を2本連結）や森ノ宮電車区所属の103系（オレンジ色）・201系も運用に入る。

sen.j: 普通列車（英字表記 Local）は各駅に停車する列車で、主にJR難波 - 柏原・王寺・奈良間で運転されている。

sen.e: After the timetable revision of September 30, 1995, the one for Kashiwara was extended to Oji and during the daytime only the one for Nara and Oji ran, and in the time table from March 8, 1997 to March 18. 2006 (the timetable was revised) the one for Oji and Nara were operated during the daytime.

sen.e: This meant that at each station between Kashiwara and Oji, the number of running trains was decreased by half, changing back to twenty minute intervals instead of ten minute intervals.

sen.e: The locals for Nara, as the subsequent trains of the rapid trains for Takada waiting for the other trains to pass at Kashiwara station, have gathered the passengers from Oji station to Nara quarter.

Trains running to Takada enter line four at Oji Station.

sen.e: In the early morning there are the ones between JR Namba and Kamo, the direct ones from JR Namba to Nara Line as a one-way one and in the early morning and at midnight there are the ones regionally operated between Oji and Nara.

There are early morning local trains that run between JR Namba and Kamo, direct trains that run only one way from JR Namba on the Nara Line, as well as regionally operated trains that run late at night between Oji and Nara.

tit.j: 快速列車との接続、通過待ち
tit.e: The connection with rapid trains and waiting for the train to pass.
Connections with rapid trains and waiting for trains to pass
Connections with rapid trains and waiting for trains to pass

sen.j: 2009年3月現在、久宝寺・王寺と天王寺（一部列車のみ）で快速列車との緩急接続を行っており、平野駅 (JR西日本)や柏原でも快速列車の待避が行われている。
sen.e: As of March 2009, they undergo pacing attachments with rapid trains at Kyuhoji, Oji and Tennoji (only some of them) and also at Hirano station (JR West Japan) or Kashiwara, rapid trains wait for the other ones to pass.

As of March of 2009, island platforms for transfer between local trains and rapid trains were put into operation at Kyuhoji, Oji and Tennoji (only for a few trains), and passing loops were put into operation for rapid trains at Hirano Station (JR West Japan) and Kashiwara.
sen.cmt: There doesn't seem to be an equivalent word in English for "緩急接続" so I used the desciption "island platforms for transfer between local trains and rapid trains"; used "passing loop" for "待避"; caplitalized "Station"; fixed grammar to read more understandably
sen.e: As of March of 2009, island platforms for transfer between local trains and rapid trains were put into operation at Kyuhoji, Oji and Tennoji (only for a few trains), and passing loops were put into operation for rapid trains at Hirano Station (JR West Japan) and Kashiwara.

sen.j: しかし、1994年9月4日の関西国際空港開港時のダイヤ改正までは天王寺で緩急接続を行い、平野や柏原で後続の快速を待避するダイヤが主体であった。
sen.e: However, until the timetable revision of Kansai International Airport on September 4, 1994, they underwent pacing attachments at Tennoji and most of them waited for the other subsequent ones to pass at Hirano or Kashiwara.

Until the timetable revision of Kansai International Airport on September 4, 1994, island platforms were operated at Tennoji and the schedule had most local trains utilizing passing loops to allow rapid trains to pass at Hirano and Kashiwara.
sen.cmt: eliminated "However" since there does not seem to be a contrast between this sentence and the previous sentence (upon checking the wiki article, "しかし" is not written at the beginning of this sentence either); changed "underwent pacing attachments" to "island platforms were operated"; changed "they" to "local trains"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Until the timetable revision of Kansai International Airport on September 4, 1994, island platforms were operated at Tennoji and the schedule had most local trains utilizing passing loops to allow rapid trains to pass at Hirano and Kashiwara.

sen.j: しかし、関西国際空港開港に伴う大阪環状線 - 阪和線直通列車の増発（関空快速、はるか (列車)の登場）によって天王寺では緩急接続が頻繁にできなくなった。
sen.e: However, because the number of trains on Osaka Loop Line directly through Hanwa Line (the appearance of Kanku Rapid service, Haruka (train)) increased with the opening of Kansai International Airport, frequent pacing attachments at Tennoji came to be impossible.
sen.cmt: the wiki article has this sentence in the same paragraph as the sentence above, so I eliminated "par" in Row A and changed それが→しかし、
sen.e: However, accompanied by the opening of Kansai Internation Airport, an increased number of trains on the Osaka Loop Line running directly through the Hanwa Line (with the introduction of Kanku Rapid Service and the Haruka (train)) made it impossible for trains to pass each other using the island platform at Tennoji.
sen.cmt: used "accompanied for "伴う"; changed "the appearance of" to "with the introduction of"; changed "pacing attachments" to "trains to pass each other using the island platform"; rearranged sentence and fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: However, accompanied by the opening of Kansai International Airport, an increased number of trains on the Osaka Loop Line running directly through the Hanwa Line (with the introduction of Kanku Rapid Service and the Haruka (train)) made it impossible for trains to pass each other using the island platform at Tennoji.

sen.j: そのため平野で快速列車を待避する列車を増やすなどの努力がなされたものの、王寺方面行に関してはおおさか東線城東貨物線の貨物列車との兼ね合いもあり平野で待避する列車は数に制限があった。
sen.e: Thus, the number of trains waiting for the rapid trains to pass at Hirano was increased, but as for Oji quarter, there was the limitation of the number of the trains waiting for the other ones to pass at Hirano, considering a balance with the freight trains on the Joto Goods Line of Osaka Higashi Line.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: To remedy this situation, an increased number of local trains were allowed to use the passing loop at Hirano to allow rapid trains to pass, but in the Oji area, a limit was imposed on the number of trains that could use a passing loop in consideration of keeping a balance with freight trains on the Joto Goods Line of the Osaka Higashi Line.
sen.cmt: changed "Thus" to "To remedy this situation"; changed "trains waiting for the other ones to pass" to "trains allowed to use the passing loop"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: To remedy this situation, an increased number of local trains were allowed to use the passing loop at Hirano to allow rapid trains to pass, but in the Oji area, a limit was imposed on the number of trains that could use a passing loop in consideration of keeping a balance with freight trains on the Joto Goods Line of the Osaka Higashi Line.

sen.j: このため、普通列車がJR難波を快速発車後すぐに出発しても、後発の快速列車が久宝寺付近で先行の普通列車に追いついてしまい、柏原付近まで快速列車は徐行運転を余儀なくされることが夕方以降を中心にしばしば発生した。
sen.e: For this reason, even though a local train left JR Namba immediately after a rapid train, the subsequent rapid train caught up with the foregoing local train and thus the rapid train was often forced to run slowly until near Kashiwara chiefly after the evening.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Consequently, from the evening on, even if local trains departed from JR Namba immediately after a rapid train, the following rapid train would catch up to the local train and be forced to run slowly until the Kashiwara area.
sen.cmt: changed "For this reason" to "Consequently"; moved "after the evening" to "from the evening on" and moved it towards the beginning of the sentence; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Consequently, from the evening on, even if local trains departed from JR Nanba immediately after a rapid train, the following rapid train would catch up to the local train and be forced to run slowly until the Kashiwara area.

sen.j: さらに2008年3月15日までは阪和線への短絡線が単線であり、大阪環状線 - 阪和線間の直通列車が平面交差することから、天王寺駅近辺でも徐行が強いられることもあった。
sen.e: Furthermore, until March 15, 2008, the short-circuit line to Hanwa Line was a single track and the direct trains between Osaka Loop Line and Hanwa Line flatly crossed and thus it was sometimes forced to run slowly even near Tennoji station.
sen.cmt: 「平面交差する」をflatly crossとしました。
sen.e: Furthermore, until March 15, 2008, the short section of track to the Hanwa Line was a single track, and because direct trains between the Osaka Loop Line and the Hanwa Line use a level junction, they were sometimes forced to run slowly even around Tennoji Station.
sen.cmt: "short-circuit line" does not seem to be a train term in English. Rather, it is just a short section of track that ties two other tracks together, so I changed it to "short section of track"; changed "flatly cross" to "level junction" (though the articles are not directly linked, the one on "平面交差" and "level junction" seem to be describing the same thing); capitalized "Tennoji Station"; fixed grammar to read more understandably
sen.e: Furthermore, until March 15, 2008, the short section of track to the Hanwa Line was a single track, and because direct trains between the Osaka Loop Line and the Hanwa Line use a level junction, they were sometimes forced to run slowly even around Tennoji Station.

sen.j: 1997年に久宝寺での快速停車（当時は区間快速のみ）が実施されたのを機に、1998年に久宝寺に新たに待避線が設けられ緩急接続を行うパターンを主体としたダイヤに改められた。
sen.e: When rapid trains stopped at Kyuhoji in 1997 (in those days, only regional rapids stopped there) and the line for trains to wait for the other ones to pass was set up, the timetable was revised for mainly undergoing pacing attachments.

When it was put into practice to have rapid trains stop at Kyuhoji in 1997 (at the time it was only a stop for regional rapid trains), the opportunity was taken advantage of in 1998 by newly establishing passing loops at Kyuhoji, and a main pattern was formed around making revisions to the timetable by putting in island platforms.
sen.cmt: changed "line for trains to wait for the other ones to pass was set up" to "establishing passing loops"; changed "pacing attachments" to "putting in island platforms" for "緩急接続を行う"; added 1998 since it was missing from translation 1; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: When it was put into practice to have rapid trains stop at Kyuhoji in 1997 (at the time it was only a stop for regional rapid trains), the opportunity was taken advantage of in 1998 by newly establishing passing loops at Kyuhoji, and a main pattern was formed around making revisions to the timetable by putting in island platforms.

sen.j: それからは前述の普通奈良行が当時の区間快速高田行を待避する場合を除いて柏原で待避する列車は減少した。
sen.e: From then on, except when the locals for Nara, mentioned above, wait for the regional rapids for Takada in those days to pass, the number of trains waiting for the others to pass at Kashiwara decreased, but after the timetable revision of March 2006 (the timetable revision because of the derailment accident on the JR Fukuchiyama Line) the number of waiting at Kashiwara increased again.

sen.j: 特に王寺・奈良方面行においては久宝寺で後続の快速列車と緩急接続した後、わずか3駅先の駅でもう1本後続の快速列車を待つためダイヤに余裕が生まれる。
sen.e: Especially for the ones for Oji and Nara quarter, after they underwent pacing attachments with the subsequent rapid trains at Kyuhoji, they waited for the next rapid trains at only three stations ahead and thus the timetable came to have a room while at Kashiwara there happened maximally nine minutes of time to wait and it became rather inconvenient for the passengers using local trains over Kashiwara.

sen.j: その反面、柏原では最長9分の待ち時間が発生し、柏原をまたいで普通列車を利用する客にとってはかなり不便になってしまった。

sen.j: 2008年3月のおおさか東線の開業により、王寺方面行きの普通列車は久宝寺で快速列車と緩急接続した後、続いて入線するおおさか東線の列車を待つダイヤが多く組まれるようになったため、おおむね久宝寺での停車時間が若干長くなり、柏原での停車時間が若干短くなった。
sen.e: By the opening of Osaka Higashi Line in March 2008, according to many timetables, after local trains for Oji quarter underwent pacing attachments with rapid trains at Kyuhoji and waited for the subsequently entering train on Osaka Higashi Line and thus mostly the time to wait at Kyuhoji became a little longer and the time to wait at Kashiwara a little shorter.

With the opening of the Osaka Higashi Line in March of 2008, once island platforms were implemented at Kyuhoji to make transfers between local trains running to the Oji area and rapid trains, stop times generally became a few minutes longer at Kyuhoji and a few minutes shorter at Kashiwara due to many timetables being set to have local trains wait for the new train running on the Osaka Higashi Line.

tit.e: New Year's Eve all night operation

sen.e: In the Urban Network area, except on some line sections, all night operation from New Year's Eve to New Year's Day is done, but there are temples and shrines such as Kasuga Taisha Shrine, Chogosonshi-ji Temple or so on along the Line and recently local trains run roughly every thirty minutes between Nara and JR Namba.

Within the Urban Network area, except for a few line sections, trains are operated all night from New Year's Eve to New Year's Day, but because of temples and shrines such as Kasuga Taisha Shrine and Chogosonshi-ji Temple being along the line, local trains have recently been run roughly every thrity minutes between Nara and JR Namba.

sen.e: And in the daytime, apart from the regional rapids, the rapid trains ran through Yamato-Koizumi station and Koriyama station (Nara prefecture) (the color of category curtain was orange and in those days the character styles of old banners were written in red) and the trains which ran directly through between JR Namba and Takada during the daytime but became the ones stopping at every station in Wakayama Line were also operated as "rapid trains," not as "regional rapid trains."

sen.e: The difference of patterns of the stops between the regional rapids on Osaka Loop Line and these category trains was because of this, but by the timetable revision of March 15, 2008, the trains which had the same stopping pattern were again called "rapid trains" (Kyuhoji as a stop was added to the stops of the rapid trains in the past).

sen.j: また、阪和線から大和路線に乗り入れる221系の運用もあるため、阪和線にダイヤ乱れが発生するとJR難波発 快速加茂・五条行の列車にも遅延が発生する場合がある。

sen.e: The section between Tennoji and Shin-Imamiya is apart from Osaka Loop Line (double track), and there are the trains to and from JR Namba, which run along the other line from Osaka Loop Line and start from Shin-Imamiya, and Yamatoji rapid trains are changed to the ones to and from JR Namba by the change of stations of departure and arrival by the suspension and operational arrangement, which thus alleviates, though a little, the influence of delays of direct trains from the other lines in Osaka Loop Line.

sen.e: A quadruple track section separates the Yamatoji Line and Osaka Loop Line between Tennoji and Shin-Imamiya, and from Shin-Imamiya, trains arriving and departing from JR Nanba also run on a track separated from the Osaka Loop Line.

sen.j: また、大和路快速を運休および運転整理による発着駅変更してJR難波発着に切り替えることにより、若干ではあるが大阪環状線内での他路線からの直通列車の遅延の影響を緩和している。

sen.j: 奈良電車区所属の車両はすべて他路線（京阪神緩行線、大阪環状線、片町線など）からの転入で、関西本線には電化以来一度も通勤型新車投入がない。
sen.e: All the vehicles belonging to Nara Train Depot were transferred from the other lines (Keihanshin Local Train Line, Osaka Loop Line, Katamachi Line and so on) and in Kansai Main Line, there has been no setup of a new commuter train after the electrification.

All of the railroad cars that belong to Nara Train Depot were transferred from other lines (Keihanshin Local Train Line, Osaka Loop Line, Katamachi Line, etc.), while on the Kansai Main Line, there has been no setup of a new commuter train since the tracks were electrified.

sen.j: 電化当時の関西本線では大阪環状線や中央線快速から転入した国鉄101系電車が運用されていたが、1983年から1985年にかけ、京阪神緩行線への201系投入によって捻出された103系に置き換えられた。
sen.e: In Kansai Main Line at the time of electrification, JNR 101 series, transferred from Osaka Loop Line and Chuo Line rapid train, were used, but from 1983 to 1985, the setup of 201 series in Keihanshin Local Train Line changed them to 103 series.

At the time of electrification on the Kansai Main Line, the JNR 101 series cars, which were transferred from the Osaka Loop Line and Chuo rapid trains, were put into operation, but from 1983 to 1985, the setup of having the 201 series on the Keihanshin Local Train Line was changed to the 103 series.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: At the time of electrification on the Kansai Main Line, the JNR 101 series cars, which were transferred from the Osaka Loop Line and Chuo rapid trains, were put into operation, but from 1983 to 1985, the setup of having the 201 series on the Keihanshin Local Train Line was changed to the 103 series.

sen.j: 6両編成と4両編成は奈良電車区所属車、8両編成は大阪環状線から乗り入れる森ノ宮電車区所属車である。
sen.e: 6-car train sets and 4-car train sets belong to Nara Train Depot and 8-car train sets belong to Morinomiya Train Depot connecting with Osaka Loop Line.

sen.e: Six-car sets and four-car sets belong to Nara Train Depot, and eight-car sets belong to Morinomiya Train Depot, which connects to the Osaka Loop Line.

sen.j: 6両編成は主として大和路線普通列車およびおおさか東線での運用だが、ラッシュ時には快速や和歌山線、桜井線にも運用される。
sen.e: 6-car train sets are operated mainly in Yamatoji Line local trains and Osaka Higashi Line, but during rush hours also in rapid trains, Wakayama Line and Sakurai Line.
Six-car sets are mainly operated as local trains on the Yamatoji Line and and the Osaka Higashi Line, but during rush hour they are also used as rapid trains on the Wakayama Line and Sakurai Line.

sen.j: 京阪神緩行線（JR京都線・JR神戸線）・福知山線へのJR西日本321系電車投入により201系が大和路線に転用され、本系列の6両編成は本数が減少している。
sen.e: The incorporation of JR-West Commuter Trains Series 321 into Keihanshin Local Train Line (JR Kyoto Line and JR Kobe Line) and Fukuchiyama Line made 201 series transfer to be used in Yamatoji Line and thus the number of operation of main group 6-car train sets decreased.

The incorporation of the JR West 321 Commuter Train series into the Keihanshin Local Train Line (JR Kyoto Line and JR Kobe Line) and the Fukuchiyama Line resulted in the 201 series being transferred to the Yamatoji Line, decreasing the number of six-car sets in operation.

sen.e: The incorporation of the JR West 321 Commuter Train series into the Keihanshin Local Train Line (JR Kyoto Line and JR Kobe Line) and the Fukuchiyama Line resulted in the 201 series being transferred to the Yamatoji Line, decreasing the number of six-car sets in operation.

sen.j: それでも、おおさか東線の開業で6両編成の運用数自体が増えたため全面的な置き換えには至っていない。
sen.e: However, the opening of Osaka Higashi Line increased the number of operation of 6-car train sets, which did not lead to a total displacement.
However, since the number of six-car sets increased with the opening of the Osaka Higashi Line, not all of the sets were replaced.

sen.j: 4両編成は奈良線での運用が中心であるが、大和路線でも2本連結して8両編成として大阪環状線へ直通する区間快速で使用されるほか、大阪環状線内だけ（環状運転）の運用もある。
sen.e: 4-car train sets are mainly used in Nara Line, but in Yamatoji Line two of them are connected as 8-car train sets and are used as regional rapids running directly through Osaka Loop Line or operated only in Osaka Loop Line (Loop operation).
sen.cmt: 「環状運転」をLoop operation としました。
sen.e: Four-car sets are mainly used on the Nara Line, but two are connected to make eight-car sets on the Yamatoji Line and used a regional rapid trains that run either directly through or operated exclusively on the Osaka Loop Line.

sen.e: Four-car sets are mainly used on the Nara Line, but two are connected to make eight-car sets on the Yamatoji Line and used a regional rapid trains that run either directly through or operated exclusively on the Osaka Loop Line.

sen.j: 大和路線・奈良線の103系は長年に渡り関西圏や首都圏の各地から寄せ集められたため1編成の製造時期と形態が1両ごとに違う編成が多い。
sen.e: As 103 series on Yamatoji Line and Nara Line have been aggregated from various areas of Kansai region or capital region, there are many train sets where the production time and form of each car are different.

Due to the 103 series cars on the Yamatoji Line and Nara Line being gathered from various areas in the Kansai and capital regions, there are many train sets that were produced at different times and made in different shapes.

sen.j: 1986年11月1日国鉄ダイヤ改正で編成両数を短くしつつ日中の運転本数を増やす施策が取られたため、国鉄末期からJR初期にかけては3両編成も存在した（ラッシュ時は2編成を併結した6両編成で運転）。
sen.e: Due to the timetable revision of November 1, 1986, the number of car-train set was reduced and the number of operation during the daytime was increased and there existed 3-car train sets from the end of JNR period to the early time of JR (6-car train sets, which consist of two 3-car train sets, ran during rush hours).

Due to a policy being enforced in timetable revision made on November 1, 1986, where the number of cars in a set were reduced while the number of trains in operation during the daytime were increased, there were three-car train sets that existed from the end of the JNR period to the early JR period (six-car train sets, consisting of two three-car sets were run during rush hour).
sen.cmt: added "policy being enforced" for "施策が取られた"; fixed grammar to read more understandably
sen.e: Due to a policy being enforced in timetable revision made on November 1, 1986, where the number of cars in a set were reduced while the number of trains in operation during the daytime were increased, there were three-car train sets that existed from the end of the JNR period to the early JR period (six-car train sets, consisting of two three-car sets were run during rush hour).

sen.j: しかし、乗客増に伴い、1994年に京阪神緩行線への207系投入によって捻出されたサハ103形を組み込んで4両編成化され、現在は存在しない。
sen.e: However, with the increase of passengers, the setup of 207 series into Keihanshin Local Train Line in 1994 made Saha 103 series incorporate into them and they became 4-car train sets and now 3-car train sets do not exist.

With the increase in the number of passengers, however, the adoption of the 207 series for the Keihanshin Local Train Line in 1994 meant that the Saha 103 series was incorporated into the train set, resulting in 3-car train sets being replaced by 4-car train sets.
sen.cmt: My revised version is a little 意訳 but it reads more naturally, I think. The nuance of "存在しない" is covered in the meaning of "replace."
sen.e: With the increase in the number of passengers, however, the adoption of the 207 series for the Keihanshin Local Train Line in 1994 meant that the Saha 103 series was incorporated into the train set, resulting in 3-car train sets being replaced by 4-car train sets.

tit.j: 電車前面の白線について
tit.e: On the white line of the face of trains
About the white line on the face of trains
About the white line on the face of trains

sen.j: 大和路線に使用される103系・201系はほかのJR西日本の路線のそれらと違い前面に帯状の白線が塗ってあるが、これは踏切事故防止の目的で塗られている警戒色である。
sen.e: 103 series and 201 series used in Yamatoji Line are painted with a white line on the train face unlike the ones on the other Lines of JR West Japan, and this is a warning coloration for prevention of accidents at grade crossings.
Unlike other JR West Japan trains, a white line is painted on the front of the 103 series and 201 series used on the Yamatoji Line as a warning to prevent accidents at railroad crossings.
sen.cmt: rearranged sentence to read more naturally; changed "grade crossings" to "railroad crossings" for "踏切" since the latter seems to be the more common term;
sen.e: Unlike other JR West Japan trains, a white line is painted on the front of the 103 series and 201 series used on the Yamatoji Line as a warning to prevent accidents at railroad crossings.

sen.j: 関西本線湊町（現JR難波） - 奈良電化開業時には黄色（黄5号）に塗られていた（帯なしの時もあった）。
sen.e: At the electrification opening of Minatomachi (currently, JR Namba) and Nara on Kansai Main Line, they were painted with yellow (yellow number 5) (there were some times of no banner).
With the opening of electrified tracks on the Kansai Main Line between Minatomachi (currencly JR Namba) and Nara, the trains were painted yellow (yellow number five) (sometimes there was no banner).
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: With the opening of electrified tracks on the Kansai Main Line between Minatomachi (currently JR Nanba) and Nara, the trains were painted yellow (yellow number five) (sometimes there was no banner).

sen.j: これは、直線区間が多く普通列車でもスピードを出すためや、直線のため見通しが良く、かえって油断して遮断機が降りても無理に横断する人や自動車に対して警戒を促すためのものである。
sen.e: This was because even local trains picked up speed on many straight line sections, and as vistaed on the straight line, people or cars tried to cross the line unvigilantly even after the crossing bars were closed and thus it was necessary for them to be warned.

It became necessary to paint the trains yellow in order to urge caution against attempting to cross the tracks after the crossing bars were lowered since even local trains picked up speed and had unobstructed views on straight line sections.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: It became necessary to paint the trains yellow in order to urge caution against attempting to cross the tracks after the crossing bars were lowered since even local trains picked up speed and had unobstructed views on straight line sections.

sen.j: 奈良 - 王寺間では沿線に住宅が少なく、水田・田園地帯を進むが、法隆寺 - 王寺間では大和川やその支流で奈良県特有の濃霧（特に春先から夏頃まで）が発生するため、視認性を上げるために警戒色が必要とされる。
sen.e: Between Nara and Oji there are a few residential houses along the Line which runs through pastoral and paddy field zone, but between Horyuji and Oji there happens heavy fog, peculiar to Nara prefecture, near Yamato river or the tributaries and thus to enhance the visibility the warning coloration is considered to be necessary.

There are a few residential areas along the line between Nara and Oji, which is a pastoral and paddy field zone, and heavy fog peculiar to Nara Prefecture occurs between Horyuji and Oji (particularly from early spring to around summertime) near the Yamato River and the tributaries, thus making warning colors necessary in order to enhance the visibility of the trains
sen.cmt: added translation for （特に春先から夏頃まで）; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: There are a few residential areas along the line between Nara and Oji, which is a pastoral and paddy field zone, and heavy fog peculiar to Nara Prefecture occurs between Horyuji and Oji (particularly from early spring to around summertime) near the Yamato-gawa River and the tributaries, thus making warning colors necessary in order to enhance the visibility of the trains
